I think that in many respects we are arriving at an understanding upon these matters, and, therefore, I am led to hope that we shall dispose of the business engaging our attention without undue debate, and thus-obviate the necessity for all-night sittings. Upon that understanding. I shall ask that, progress be reported.

Speaker: Mr DUGALD THOMSON
Title: AYES
text: We cannot sit both night and 'day.

Speaker: Sir WILLIAM LYNE
Title: AYES
text: --That is why I appeal to honourable members to assist me.

Speaker: Mr DUGALD THOMSON
Title: AYES
text: Hav e 'we not endeavoured to do so?

Speaker: Sir WILLIAM LYNE
Title: AYES
text: I quite admit that the members of trie Opposition have hot talked very much today, and in that respect, I recognise that they have extended consideration to the Government. Progress reported.
